title: Basic Programming Concepts
description: Test your knowledge of fundamental programming concepts

options.text: A container for storing data values

questions.explanation: A variable is a named storage location for holding data that can be modified during program execution.

questions.text: Which of the following is a valid way to comment code in Python?
questions.explanation: In Python, single-line comments start with the # symbol.

questions.text: What is the purpose of a 'for' loop?

options.text: To iterate over a sequence of elements

questions.explanation: A for loop is used to iterate over a sequence (like a list, tuple, or string) and execute a set of statements for each item in the sequence.

questions.text: What does the 'return' statement do in a function?

options.text: Prints a value to the console
Sends a value back to the caller of the function

questions.explanation: The return statement exits a function and sends a value back to the code that called the function.
